page.title: 05Kent Music School
page.content: Kent Music School (KMS) started in Maidstone about 1953. In September 1981 a centre was started at Sevenoaks County Primary School. It was put together by several teachers and then built up. By 1985 it had 152 pupils, 14 teachers and 12 instruments were taught. There are two orchestras and a wind band. A lesson at the centre costs around 27 pounds per term for a child and 46 pounds for an adult. Instrument hire costs 6 pounds per term. Music exams for grades 1-8 cost from 2 to 16 pounds. As well as the 152 pupils that have regular lessons there are also over 200 who attend the many workshops held at the centre. In Kent there are 12 other centres but only 3 are based in schools.
